intro: Celmisia ruahinensis, commonly known as the Ruahine celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Celmisia ruahinensis is valued for its ecological role and is often found in native New Zealand gardens.
